location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 371 of 1851 from Lieutenant Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bushire to Lieutenant Colonel Justin Sheil, HM Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, Tehran

mods.abstract: The letter is reporting that a garrison transported for Karrack [Bandar-e ChƒÅrak] island has been sent back by Mirza Hassan Ally Khan, Governor of Bushire, as a result of their poor behaviour, and his fears over how they might treat the local inhabitants. It further mentions that Shaikh Nasir's wife and mother have been permitted to proceed to India..
